title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.12.36 | 16-09-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
segments.summary: The lecture begins with the chanting of various Vaishnava mantras and prayers.

segments.key_quote: Simply taking birth in the family of a brahmana does not make one qualified to perform yajnas one must be twice born by proper training and initiation from the bona fide acharya
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verses from Srimad Bhagavatam and explains Srila Prabhupada's commentary on the importance of qualified brahmanas for performing sacrifices, emphasizing that birth alone is insufficient.

segments.key_quote: Such brahma bandhus or unqualified once born skyans must be rejected for any purpose of religious responsibility
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the necessity of proper training and initiation for brahmanas, stating that unqualified brahmanas are equated with shudras and should not be entrusted with religious duties, highlighting Krishna's role in ensuring qualified individuals performed sacrifices.

segments.key_quote: O Saunaka, thereafter the Lord, having bade farewell to King Yudhishthira, Draupadi and other relatives, started for the city of Dwaraka, accompanied by Arjuna and other members of the Yadu dynasty.
segments.summary: The speaker reads and explains the meaning of the 36th verse, describing Lord Krishna's departure for Dwaraka after bidding farewell to Yudhishthira and others.

segments.key_quote: In Kali Yuga, only the Sankirtan Yagna is recommended.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the importance of qualified priests for Vedic sacrifices and notes their rarity in the current age (Kali Yuga), recommending the chanting of the holy name as the primary yagna.

segments.key_quote: O earthly gods, kindly hear us.
segments.summary: The speaker narrates a story about Krishna and Balarama sending covered boys to ask brahmanas performing a Vedic sacrifice for food, illustrating the boys' respectful approach and their explanation of their needs.

segments.key_quote: If you associate with Krishna or his pure devotee, then automatically you are able to get enlightenment simply by performing devotional service
segments.summary: The speaker explains that association with Krishna or his devotees leads to enlightenment and understanding of religious principles, emphasizing that the brahmanas should have immediately offered food to Krishna and Balarama.

segments.key_quote: The brahmanas lost that opportunity for rendering pure devotion service to Krishna
segments.summary: The speaker continues the story, explaining the boys' understanding of when food can be accepted and highlighting the brahmanas' mistake in ignoring the request, thus missing an opportunity for devotional service.

segments.key_quote: Krishna accepts either directly from the devotee or through the medium of another devotee provided it is offered with devotion.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by emphasizing that Krishna accepts offerings made with devotion, either directly or through a devotee, and reiterates that the brahmanas missed the central point by ignoring the boys' request, ending with a thank you and Hare Krishna.
